data.title: FRN36state.net
data.text:
Taraba State derives its name from the River Taraba. Jalingo is the capital of Taraba State and is populated by Jukun, Mumuye, Wurkun, Fulani peoples among other tribes.

Till 1991, Taraba state was part of Gongola and previously in the Benue-Plateau State of North-East Nigeria.

Taraba State is a transnational border State with some the border territories claimed by both The Republic of Cameroun and the seceding Federal Republic of Ambazonia.

Jalingo is the capital city of Taraba State ans is populated by Jukun, Mumuye, Wurkun, Fulani peoples among many who are part of old Kwararafa Kingdom and Wukari Federation straddling the Benue-Plateau and parts of North West Cameroun.

Postal Code: 660101-271

Area Dial Code: Jalingo 079/Wukari 041

Railway: Jos/Bukuru/Plateau Railway line

Airport: Jalingo Aiport (IATA:Pending) and (ICAO:DNJA)

The following tertiary institutions are situated in Taraba State:

Taraba state University

Federal University, Wukari

Kwararafa University. Wukari

Federal Polytechnic, Bali

Jalingo Collge of Agriculture

Federal Science Technology College, Jalingo

College of Education, Jalingo

Federal Government Collge, Wukari

The following persons have represented Taraba State as Governors and Administrators:

Darius Dickson Ishaku

Abubakar Sani Danladi

Alhaji Garba Umar

Danfulani Baba Suntai

Jolly Tavoro Nyame

Bala Nuhu

Emmanuel John

Yohanna Dickson

Adeyemi Afolahan

The following persons currently represent Taraba State in the House of Representatives of the Federal Republic of Nigeria:

Abdulsalam Mubarak-Jalingo/Yorro/Zing

Danladi Baidu-Ardo Kola/Lau/Karim/Lamido

Rima Kwewum-Donga/Ussa/Takum

Shiddi Usman-Wukari/Ibi

David Abel-Gashaka/Kurmi/Sardauna

Kasimu Maigari-Bali/Gassol
